intro: Ctenitis inaequalifolia, commonly known as the unequal-pinnate tree fern, is a species native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of large, feathery fronds that can reach several meters in length. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its fronds are divided into numerous pinnae, which are unequal in size, giving the plant its specific epithet. Ctenitis inaequalifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
